insights.quote: I only really care about like when I go to the site, I want to ... see, you know, what the goal of the organization is.
insights.significance: Highlights the user's primary focus when visiting the site.
insights.insight: Users prioritize understanding the organization's purpose quickly.

insights.quote: I typically the events calendar view, just because it has it laid out in a way where I can ... see the various see more than I can with the list view.
insights.significance: Reveals the user's preference for visual layouts over textual lists.
insights.insight: Users find visual representations of information more helpful in navigating events.

insights.quote: If I see wait list, wait list, wait list for every single thing I'm interested in, then I kind of stop looking at the website too.
insights.significance: Expresses frustration with repeated waitlisting, leading to disengagement.
insights.insight: Frequent waitlists discourage users from continuing to explore events.

insights.quote: I think that creates extra, like, it sucks up more time for it causes more work for everybody.
insights.significance: Indicates the user's concern about the impact of cancellation processes.
insights.insight: Users desire a more efficient way to cancel events to save time for themselves and organizers.

insights.quote: I just want to hit cancel if it turns out I can't make something.
insights.significance: Directly expresses the user's need for a straightforward cancellation option.
insights.insight: Users want simplicity and ease in managing their event participation.

insights.quote: I think we could streamline the website to make it more minimal.
insights.significance: Suggests a desire for a more organized and less cluttered user experience.
insights.insight: Users feel overwhelmed by excessive options and prefer a cleaner interface.

insights.quote: There's a lot of verbiage that I'm probably not going to read on the page.
insights.significance: Reveals the user's tendency to skip over lengthy text.
insights.insight: Users prefer concise information and may overlook important details if overwhelmed by text.

insights.quote: I wasn't aware of the 20 to 40 somethings committee.
insights.significance: Shows a disconnect between the organization's offerings and user awareness.
insights.insight: Users may miss out on relevant groups or events due to ineffective communication.

insights.quote: I don't go to the page ... it just doesn't really serve much purpose for me.
insights.significance: Indicates that certain features of the website are not valuable to the user.
insights.insight: Not all content is relevant to users, leading to disengagement.

insights.quote: I mean, I guess ... it doesn't really matter to me.
insights.significance: Reflects the user's lack of interest in certain website features.
insights.insight: Users may not see value in features that are not directly aligned with their needs.

insights.quote: It was really clear to me, you know, you want to meet people in the community.
insights.significance: Affirms the primary motivation for joining the organization.
insights.insight: Community engagement is a key driver for users seeking membership.

insights.quote: I think it would be helpful to know which events still have openings.
insights.significance: Expresses a desire for more transparency regarding event availability.
insights.insight: Users want to know their chances of participating in events to avoid disappointment.

insights.quote: I did go in the committees tab once ... because I wanted to see what else was.
insights.significance: Indicates that users may only engage with certain features when they have a specific purpose.
insights.insight: User engagement with less popular features is driven by necessity rather than interest.

insights.quote: I think your point- I'm not saying it's too extra.
insights.significance: Highlights the user's consideration of balancing functionality with simplicity.
insights.insight: Users recognize the need for a streamlined approach while valuing available features.
